text: The Jade-Blooded Taoists of Yongchang Spirit Palace obey only the summons of the Jade Court. They study the Wind of Life to master their desires, but remain under the watchful eyes of the Moonlight Division by the Jade Dragon's decree.
The Jade Lions, with their fierce gaze, stand as stalwart guardians, repelling all evil spirits and demons with their commanding presence.
Jet Lions protect the mountain gates with unyielding dignity. In times of rebellion, they answer the Emperor's command to cleanse the land of corruption.

The Moonlight Division is a secretive organization directly under the Moon Empress's command. With silver avian emblems on their black robes, they secure victories in unreachable places for Cathay's people.

Hong Ying, the "Moon Raven," is rumored to carry the bloodline of the shadow dragon. A trusted draconic lord of the Moon Empress, he oversees the Moonlight Division and commands a significant part of the Onyx Crow Sentinels.
The Onyx Crow Sentinels are elite operatives of the Moon Empress, crafted by her mastery of divination winds. They serve as the sharpest eyes and deadliest blades of Cathay.
The oldest and most ferocious creation of the Star-God, the Stegadon is only approachable by those chosen by Ixti. Its mighty bows and blowpipes rain thunderous death on enemies.
The largest and most bloodthirsty Ripperdactyls wield razor-sharp talons capable of decapitating foes, leaving trails of entrails and severed limbs in their wake.
Experimental jetpacks provide enough thrust to counter the recoil of Iron Drakes. Veterans roasting Skaven and Greenskins call themselves "Flying Dragons".
Elite warriors mount rare black mountain goats. One hammer strike can either shatter enemy skulls or dislocate their own arms.
Burnt Iron? What rebellious engineer named this new weapon? Aren’t these goats just singed from battle smoke?
Gentle goats are a vital meat source for Dwarfs, but the unruly troublemakers are sent to the battlefield before the kitchen.
A few pints of Bugman’s Brew can give you incredible strength, but I say: Dawi! Aim properly and don’t shoot my beer barrels!
Though these Slayers can leap higher than most Dwarfs, claiming they can strike a flying dragon? Grungni, protect them!
Remember, lad, when patrolling and spotting a Goblin, stay patient and hide. There may be a horde of Greenskins right behind him. —Modin Whitebeard, Longbeard Warrior.
Grimnir, the god of war, protected the fledgling Dwarfs from monstrous threats and is especially revered by oath-bound Slayers.
Grungni, god of mining and forging, is the father of Dwarfs, teaching them to extract and shape the precious metals within the earth.
Morgrim, god of engineering, was the first to instruct Dwarf clans in the creation of tools, machinery, and engines of war.
The greatest Runecrafters and Engineers Guilds collaborated to create tireless sentinels. These marvels are both a source of immense pride and profound sorrow for the Dwarfs.
The greatest Runecrafters and Engineers Guilds collaborated to create tireless sentinels. These marvels are both a source of immense pride and profound sorrow for the Dwarfs.
The greatest Runecrafters and Engineers Guilds collaborated to create tireless sentinels. These marvels are both a source of immense pride and profound sorrow for the Dwarfs.
These colossus guardians bear runes forged by Grungni himself amidst thunderous storms. Those who approach too closely are reduced to charred remains.
Rune Guardians (Runic Gatling Guns)
Valaya, the creator of runes, grudges, and oaths, embodies Dwarven culture. She governs healing, unity, family, and is also the goddess of ale.

Each Blade Legion is led by a rabid Bloodletter, gathering skulls not for themselves but for their enraged master. While they appear as taskmasters for the warhounds, these champions have their own prey to hunt. Unlike the fleshy hounds, they comprehend the minds of mortal prey, predicting their every move.
Each Blade Legion follows a rabid Bloodletter commander. Clad in blood-soaked heavy armor and wielding brass hellblades, they violently claim skulls from the weak with calculated fury.
How does one "crush" blood? Better with this unendingly massive axe. These lunatics are truly insane.
Rather than offering a dragon’s skull in sacrifice, the Blood God prefers branding their souls with blazing marks, binding them to eternal servitude.
The fearsome lieutenants of Ka’Bandha hail from the Eighth Legion of Unbridled Wrath. Though marked by failure in Khorne's eyes, the Blood Hunt offers them a chance to reclaim honor.
Brave Chaos warriors must endure grueling rituals, repeatedly piercing the beast with a magical blade to tame this massive blood-crazed monstrosity.
Cowards' souls are trapped within these infernal constructs, their sole value as fuel for the creation of hellfire.
Nothing pleases the Blood God more than skulls. If one thrown skull yields more, prepare for ascension!
Snow Eagles soar through the skies as storms descend. Their icy arrows are nocked and ready to strike.
Only the bravest warriors among the royal guard earn the title of Golden Knight. Each knight is gifted a newly forged, radiant armor said to hold enchantments.
The Ice Court crafts armor from millennia-old ice, both lightweight and durable. The Ice Guard and their mighty bears, armed and ready, embody unparalleled grace and ferocity.
After reforms by the Ice Queen, the Kreml Guards retain their black armor tradition. They stand firm against Chaos, their unique duckfoot rifles ensuring northern invaders falter.
Kreml Guards maintain their black armor tradition, now wielding halberds to repel Chaos. Their volatile kvass transforms battlefields into fiery infernos.
During the Red Tzar era, some Kreml Guards trained in Erengrad with Streltsi techniques. They excel in precise musketry and wielding poleaxes with unmatched skill.
Taming the temperamental moose rivals forming bonds with Ursun's progeny. Armoured and charging, they unleash blizzards on the battlefield.
When you hear the moose's call, flee before you're trampled! That’s Kislev's frosty vengeance taking form.
Huge and powerful elk are found in the northern borders of Kislev. Capturing this species is exceptionally difficult, but their immense endurance and strength make it all worthwhile.
Dazh, the god of fire and the sun, pours molten gold upon the rampaging lava elemental, incinerating all impurities in the rising flames.
Salyak, the goddess of healing and comfort, shapes life essence into a divine statue. Its wooden body bears miracles, bringing hope of life like the white birds of early spring.
Tor, the god of lightning and warriors, wields a giant oak axe to cleave the sky, manifesting a thunderous elemental to bring the fury of summer storms to the battlefield.
The bear god’s statue rests atop an enormous frost construct, embodying cold and death. Kislev’s fate and Ursun's blessings are deeply intertwined.
The Ungol people are adept at taming snow eagles. When the border rises in smoke, their sharp eyes hunt for enemies thousands of miles away.
The wild beasts of the homeland prowl its forests, including divine leopards with icy wings that soar gracefully, delivering chilling torment to all who witness them.
The Changing God's twisted creation showcases the full extent of magic’s might.
The God of Excess deems this their highest art, transforming the battlefield into an unnamed dreamscape.
The Blood God’s infernal machine spews Khorne’s flames, bringing death to the mortal realm.
Compared to typical chariots, this one boasts an additional marksman who hurls firestones to disrupt enemy ranks before charging in.
Azure iron rides through the mist, halberds reap foes like grain, and the thunderous sound of hooves shatters formations.
Shrouded in clouds, the dragon’s wrath descends. Sails rise with the wind, and the vessel glides a thousand miles in one stroke.
Earth, wind, fire, and water heed the command of this compass; lightning is unleashed, arrows return to strike their origin—all in accordance with the Emperor’s decree.
The Four Gods are but jesters! Zhao Ming, let the Dragon Transformation Technique bring their end!
A dim blue lantern guides spirits, and none dare disturb the serenity of the Great Bastion, for where the soul banner passes, no living thing remains.
Forged of jade and armed with mace, this terracotta sentinel patrols, killing all intruders.
The iron colossus from Nan-Gau protects the frontier. Its thunderous roar shakes the heavens and earth.
With golden axe and halberd, it reaps enemy heads, serving the Dragon God for millennia, guarding the impenetrable Heavenly Gates.
Forged of black jade, its iron arms draw the bow, striking foes from a hundred yards away.
The jade lion stares fiercely to ward off evil spirits, standing proud at the front lines, deterring all vile creatures.
The stone beast guards the mountain gate, but with chaos rising and disrupting serenity, it follows the monks to purge evil.
Legends speak of this dragon ferrying Cathayan souls between realms. If the Great Bastion is in peril, it descends from the Soul River to join the fray.
Clad in cold black armor, with a stoic face and piercing gaze that shatters enemy morale, its blade cuts life from death in an instant.
Black Jade Crowmen, specialists in intelligence and assassination, strike unseen and kill without a trace.
The Jade Sea’s colossal turtle bears a fortress on its back. Though slow-moving, its rain of rockets and heavy cannon fire renders it impervious to all but the mightiest armies.
Armour black as ink, blades sharp as snow, their guandao cleaves horse and rider alike, advancing as an unstoppable wall.
Eagle-eyed with piercing vision, they strike enemies from a hundred steps away or beyond.
Arrows darken the sky, shields deflect all attacks—what foe dares stand before this formation?
Forged of black jade, the flaming edge cleaves evil and shatters spells—what can you monsters do against it?
When the Jade Court requires, disciples of the Jade-Blooded Temple are summoned, using serpent-like cunning and agility to strike at their foes.
A general’s spirit animates jade armor, leading legions of terracotta warriors, forming an iron fortress against all evil.
Born carefree in the bamboo sea, now called to war against demonic hordes. These iron-eating beasts crush bones unwillingly, yearning only for peace.
Steppe nomads excel in archery, easily mastering firehawk rifles.
A crack of thunder signals the dragon’s wrath. Jade riders hurl fiery death at their foes.
Eyes sharp as stars, arrows pierce the heavens, and death falls from above.
Guardians of the Dragon Emperor, they stand proudly above all others, shining with glory.
Horns unbound by rope, it roams the earth freely, untethered by the confines of night.
Like a wildfire sweeping through, it illuminates the heavens for ninety thousand miles.
From the Heavenly Mountains it comes, plowing fields and scattering bones, claiming victory in the name of the Empire.
The highly intelligent Kroxigors fight alongside Skinks with a calm demeanor but unleash ferocious fury to tear through enemy lines.
Yocannadozat and Ta'Gras.
This is the manifestation of the Sun God's will. Lizardmen who gaze upon it are revitalized, and even their weapons glow with the power of the blazing sun.
Stars… foretell… the return of ancient foes. I must… stop them… once more.
The Sea God once walked through Itza, imbuing the Emerald Pools with immense healing powers. Now, this blessing graces the jungle battlefield.
Older Salamanders possess deep green scales and fiery temperament. Only the most trusted Skink handlers can avoid their terrifying toxic flames.
Tepok granted this unique Carnosaur the instinct to harness the Winds of Azyr. The Skink Priest guides its immense heavenly power in battle.
The bodies of fallen Lizardmen warriors are wrapped in sacred shrouds granted by the God of War, allowing them to continue protecting their Mage Priests and kin.
These intimidatingly massive Ogres, proven hunters in their warbands, can casually heft and fire harpoon launchers at any time.
Ogres aspiring to feast on dragon flesh inscribe fiery runes onto their bodies with fresh blood and hurl themselves into the fiercest flames to test their effectiveness.
To the apprentices of the Fire Mouth, having an enemy feel the heat of molten lava is the most generous blessing from their volcano god!
The tyrant’s favorite Gnoblars arm themselves as heavily as possible, especially protecting their skinny arms—no one in the tribe is short enough to grab their legs.
These chefs excel at feeding their kin with leftover bone fragments and rotting meat. The stench forces them to wear nose guards while cooking.
The craftiest Gnoblars patch together scrap metal for protection, which for Ogres, makes them perfectly canned snacks!
Frostwolves, with their keen sense of smell and agility rivaling Sabertusks, are prized by Gnoblars for aiding in swift escapes.
These scrawny arms may not matter much, but if they can smash enemies into meat patties, that’s worth it—saves us from chewing!
With a cold equal to Thunderlizards, Frost Mammoths are both a tremendous food reserve and a mighty beast only the strongest Ogres can tame.
To become a Leadbelcher master, one must survive barehanded against a pack of raging Sabertusks. The finest masters wear their trophy pelts proudly.
The Frost Mammoth’s tenderest parts can freeze an Ogre’s teeth, while its icy bones grind into pigments and carve enemies into frost shards.
Buried beneath the sands of Araby lie the remains of colossal war elephants. Eternal curses awaken these giants to roam once more.
Unfurling wings woven of anguished souls, it rains the Death God's blessings from the sky!
Tomb Guard equipped with durable halberds and shields patrol the desert depths, dispatching all intruders.
Listen to the whispers of the underworld—the God of Death calls for the souls it craves.
Awakened skeletal warriors, armed with sharp spears, ride swift and agile bone ostriches, seeking deadly openings in their enemies.
The kingdoms of Nehekhara sculpted massive stone beetles, praying for the protection of eternal sacred scarabs.
Scarabs adorned with the names and likenesses of gods, often inlaid with pure gold, possess incredible magical resistance.
Deep within the tombs of the Black Pyramid lie guardians created by legendary necromancers. Few know of their terrifying existence.
The chosen warrior spirits of Djaf wield giant blades inscribed with the God of War’s name, carving bloody paths through enemy ranks.
The divine warriors of Phakth are enigmatic, wielding Cathayan-crafted firearms of exquisite destruction to devastate foes from afar.
Slumbering for centuries in the tomb of Asaph, these colossal sculptures carved with the visage of the Crocodile God stand guard over sacred Titans.
The most loyal servant of Nagash, imbued with purest and most potent necromantic power.
Arkhan’s staff draws immense dark magic from the Black Tower, unleashing the latent power of Nagash within.
Blessed by Asaph, the Warrior Queen’s desire for vengeance transforms into the icy sting of her bowstring.
Though exiled, the High Priest of the Mortuary Cult’s contributions to Nehekhara earned Phakth’s favor.
The Immortal Emperor, King of Kings! Bow to none, ruler of all!
Ptra’s greatest gift—an immortal golden body and supreme power—fulfills the Immortal Emperor’s grand ambition.
The resilient souls of the Tomb Princes, blessed by the gods, transform them into mighty lions commanding their legions.
The visage of the Tomb Princes adorns these colossal Ushabti, emanating an aura of pure destruction.
Ah, those blood-stained hands...

The mutated sea dragon’s elongated, sinuous body and muscular limbs allow rapid movement both on land and in the ocean. Rapid regeneration heals its wounds, and endless hunger drives its relentless search for food. Its powerful tail propels it through the deep, a formidable weapon capable of shattering castle walls. In battle, they are surrounded by crushing darkness and biting cold.
The most crazed and murderous souls are locked within statues to please the Bloody-Handed God. Devout yet tragic, their power is undeniable.
Cursed by Atharti, the strongest Medusae grew bloody wings. The Goddess of Desire mocked them by restoring their spellcasting but binding their limbs and snakes.
The manticore's strength and savagery make it the ultimate killing tool, ridden by noble Black Ark Knights as avatars of Khaine himself.
Sea dragons enslaved by the Druchii are infused with the dark magic of Black Arks, mutating them into perfect hunters of the deep.
Centuries ago, the demon Tzarkan was imprisoned in Kha'Dar. Unbeknownst to all, the Black Blade freed him, intertwining his fate with the World-Drinker.
Morathi crafted this horrific mutation recipe from Medusae blood, entrails, souls, and dark magic. The maddest zealots gain unmatched power, after all.
The cursed mask on a Medusa's face is imbued with endless agony and torment. A glance from her fierce eyes will cause blood to pour from every pore.
Hekarti’s magical creations bind dark destructive energy within the endlessly regenerative body of a hydra, restrained only by enchanted armor.
The Black Arks are vast Druchii floating fortresses. Their towering spires pierce the skies, and all beyond the horizon burns to ash.

Accompanied by Skycutters, Lothern Sea Guard's sleek airborne chariots are magically protected and drawn by Swiftwing birds into battle. Their archers target smaller foes, preferring lightweight Hawk’s Talon launchers that fire steel bolts capable of felling mighty beasts. These valuable weapons provide Sea Guard with sustained firepower in combat.
Equipped with lances and bows crafted from enchanted night-yew, these Pegasus riders of Ellyrion are shielded from even the darkest sorcery.
Golden-armored Dragon Princes represent Caledor’s mightiest champions. Their blazing lances scorch all in their path, and they follow up with swift sword strikes.
Even in dire situations, White Lion Riders uphold their courage and pride, charging fearlessly regardless of the enemy’s strength or danger.
The miraculous flying fish of Cothique are seen as Mathlann’s blessing, guiding lost sailors back to warm harbors with their radiant heads.
When Skycutters encounter airborne foes, their mission becomes clear: eliminate all aerial threats and secure absolute air superiority for their elven forces.
The spirits of Ires’s fallen warriors return through Waystones, clad in golden enchanted armor, wielding willpower and strength to pierce eternal mists.
These great lions with celestial wings are seen as gifts from Asuryan. To ride one is proof of fearless hearts and noble resolve.
The elves of Nagarythe pray to the Goddesses of Fate and Death in their eternal quest for vengeance, and flocks of bloody crows heed their call.
Edenvale is the first point where the roots of the World Tree reached Ulthuan. Under the careful nurturing of generations of Everqueens, mighty guardian Treemen were born.

Sapherian mages harness Qhaysh to suspend landmasses in the air, dominating battlefields and unleashing destructive spells from the skies.
The lord of Athel Loren awakens from winter’s slumber. When the Wild Hunt’s horn echoes, Kurnous’ chosen offer grand tributes to the King of the Forest.
Bound by the Winds of Life, Zoats and Thorn Sisters call upon vines and thorns to ensnare trespassers, turning them into Athel Loren’s fertilizer.
Have you dreamed of a towering wall of green? Beware—it’s a venomous, spiked hell you’ll never wish to approach.
These ancient Dryads are reborn from fire, their souls bound to unwavering loyalty to Athel Loren. No elf oath could compare.
The Weave connects all life and death. These mighty warriors guard its nodes with eternal vigilance, ensuring the balance of souls at any cost.
Dying forest spirits bind themselves to corrupted Asrai, their whispered unity creating these tragic yet formidable beings.
The most enigmatic Thorn Sisters wield malevolent Moonfire arrows, burning trespassers who then perish amidst piercing thorns.
The lord of Athel Loren awakens from winter’s slumber. When the Wild Hunt’s horn echoes, Kurnous’ chosen offer grand tributes to the King of the Forest.
The spirit of an ancient oak, unbroken by fire, stands vigilant. Guided by spirits from Waystones, it remembers its eternal duty.
Forest resentment births such cold-hearted creatures. Graceful as dancers, their twisted limbs pierce hearts from the shadows.
The Willow Spirit heralds spring, embodies life’s source, and serves as a refuge for lost souls, aiding all who defend the forest.
After years of lightning strikes, the Poplar Spirit’s silvery body and unmatched vitality channel terrifying bolts that pierce armor and flesh alike.
Through all seasons, Birch Spirits stand watch over Athel Loren, awaiting rebirth from the ashes of dormancy.
The Dawi Tank, a formidable dwarven war machine.
An important invention of Black Fire Pass—one shot, and everything turns to dust.
The dwarven mortar, a reliable tool of destruction.
Elves received plenty of attention from airships during the War of Vengeance.
Elite airship unit.
A renowned dwarven Slayer Engineer.
A renowned dwarven Slayer Engineer.
Dwarfs using spears? Even the Elves would be surprised.
The strongest polearm warriors from the World's Edge Mountains.
Accurate—at least the goblins think so.
Longbeard warriors now wield new weapons!
What’s an Ironbreaker Knight? Lean back.
One strike with the hammer lasts a lifetime.
That’s one big bear.
Bang!
Effective at slowing down enemy advances.
Organ Gun.
Volley Gun.
Throttling firepower is the name of the game.
Thunderers gone rogue with melee weapons.
The Chaos Dwarfs might call these Ironguard ‘Thunder Gunners’.
Mountain Rangers.
New weapon—definitely not a mortar.
Vengeance! Vengeance! Vengeance!
Powerful dwarven engineers who deploy mechanical traps on the battlefield.
Used for plowing. Goblin: ?
Armed with broad axes and guns capable of evaporating any foe.
Bound by oaths to their king and the Slayer cult.
Big caliber—brace yourself.
Steam hisses, the engine roars—this cannon-mounted locomotive excels in both power and firepower.
Big caliber—brace yourself.
Thanks to Grungron’s wild imagination, more bizarre contraptions hit the battlefield, leaving trails of dust or gore wherever they roll.
The Celestial Dragon Guard wielding mighty axes are stalwart defenders of Cathay, charged by the Dragon Emperor, though their skills barely extend beyond three strikes.
Weapons forged by the artisans of Nan-Gau that make even demons retreat in fear.
The Xiaoguojun are the elite guards of Weijing, skilled in lance combat and horseback fighting, able to hold off ten enemies at once.
Skilled dual-sword users who imbue their arrows with Yin and Yang energies, striking foes unseen.
Equally adept at range and melee, these Nan-Gau elites have fought Chaos alongside the Storm Dragon herself.
These halberdiers embody the soul of the Great Bastion, forming unyielding walls of shields and spears.
Among the Jade Warriors, the fiercest wield spiked maces.
Flame demons wielding long halberds, incinerating all who dare approach.
The K'daai Destroyer towers over its foes, using blazing claws to crush fortifications and beasts, leaving only ashes in its wake.
Infused with hatred of the world, the K'daai takes the form of a massive bull, flattening hills with its charge.
Blessed by Hashut, these K'daai Destroyers possess massive brass wings, filled with dark magic and consecrated blood.
Covered in spikes and blades, any enemy foolish enough to engage in melee is likely to be shredded to pieces.

Old-Kan relishes combat against infantry, charging back and forth across the battlefield amidst swarms of foes, scattering limbs and gore like splashing water... But when faced with a worthy opponent, he fights with technique—a battle style he developed to harness brute strength more effectively.

Old-K’ja thrives on challenging the biggest opponents—the bigger, the better: snapping the necks of Carnosaurs, tearing open Stegadon's armor, dragging Dragons from the sky and pulverizing Giants' knees before smashing through their jaws. Old-K’ja delights in using—and showcasing—his boundless brute strength!

Xuan Lie, a distinguished Dragon-blooded and titled General of the Firmament, is a descendant of the Marshal Miao Ying. As one of the closest in blood to the Dragon Children, he should possess the might to summon storms and exhale mist. However, most of his vast magical power, beyond his control since youth, has instead tempered and empowered his physical form—making him even stronger than his dragon elders who soar the skies. Under Miao Ying's directive, Xuan Lie has served for centuries beneath Prince Zhaoming of Upper Yang, with whom he shares deep camaraderie and favor. Now, amidst celestial upheaval, Xuan Lie has been appointed to defend the realm and lead his troops in crushing the vile ambitions of Chaos.
Prince Zhao Xuan Lie, a paragon of the Dragon-blooded, wields the might to defy legions and surpass the strength of the Four Symbols.

The prototype of these machines dates back to the Gold Age’s great mining rush. Buried beneath rubble after countless engineers and miners were lost to the green tide, they were only recently unearthed. Now, restored and mass-produced, the survivors of that long-ago tragedy ride them into battle to finally settle the score with the Greenskins and Skaven filth.
Engine nominal, gauges green, drill spinning... but those rats coming at us? Their size isn’t exactly standard.
Thicker armor, more power, a meaner pilot—Steamfist is charging up!
Engine good, barrel rotation ready—time to shred those rats into ribbons!
Touch my steam calibrator, I dare you!

Hafdan Hardnason is a Cossar veteran who has survived countless battles. In the third year of Kislev’s Endless Winter, his regiment was embroiled in a brutal siege. At the brink of death, a lightning-wreathed warhammer fell from the skies, scattering the surrounding Norscan raiders and jolting Hafdan back from unconsciousness. He took up the hammer, led his troops out of the Chaos encirclement, and began a journey of self-trial. After defeating the warband of Howler Sorelm, liberating slaves from a Dark Elf pirate ship, toppling a mercenary giant barehanded, and winning a Dwarf drinking contest, Hafdan returned home bearing trophies: runeforged armor, a warhammer imbued with Thor’s divine power reinforced by forest spirits, and a winged Dwarf helm—his fallen friend’s legacy. He took the name "Thorsson" and returned to Kislev as a chosen warrior of the gods.
This battle-hardened Cossar veteran, blessed by Thor at death’s door, now returns to Kislev as a divine champion to continue his fight for the Motherland.

Among the ancient Kroxigors are rare exceptions—taller, more savage than their kin. Rather than laying temple foundations, these monsters excel at eliminating threats near sacred sites. Having battled for eons, they now bear holy arms left behind by the Old Ones and continue their role as sacred vanguard, clearing the path for the Great Plan.

Forged from warped flesh and grotesque machinery, these constructs are joint creations of Clan Pestilens and Clan Skryre. Horrifying experiments have repeatedly pushed the limits of Warpstone embedding and bio-mechanical fusion. Their rampages through battlefields serve as the most brutal advertisements for Skaven ingenuity.
A behemoth of bone and flame, bearing the Warshrine of the Blood God and leading Khorne's deranged faithful through the mire, leaving behind scorched remains and mangled corpses.
These rare and ancient Kroxigors are the last survivors of their spawning pools, armored in relics of the Old Ones and born to crush any who oppose the Great Plan.
The pinnacle of Clan Pestilens and Skryre engineering—Warpstone and weaponry embedded far beyond what should be survivable, pulsing in twisted flesh.
This abomination, fitted by Clan Skryre with endless drills, burrows through the sturdiest gates while clouds of Warpstone fragments drift ominously into the skies.
Filled to bursting with Warpstone fuel, this beast spews forth massive green flames. Warpstone is its lifeblood—an everburning heart of corruption.
